techmeme.title: An investigation details how scammers are using crypto ATMs to commit fraud; the FBI says US losses from scams carried out via crypto ATMs was $120M+ in 2023 (OCCRP)
The officers of India's largest retirement fund, the EPFO, warn the organization's crash-prone IT systems require immediate attention of the Union Government (Vikas Dhoot/The Hindu)
Microsoft says it cannot wall off its OS due to a 2009 deal with the EC to give security software makers the same level of access to Windows that Microsoft gets (Wall Street Journal)
OpenSecrets: ~80% of donations from internet companies have gone to Democrats so far this US election cycle, down from 90% in 2020, as support for Trump grows (Financial Times)
Starlink faces regulatory obstacles in Africa, as countries worry about losing control over content and the company providing services without paying taxes (Sultan Quadri/Semafor)
